    Algorithms to convert a numerical value in a given alphabet to a number

    • Method Detail

      • __bigint_set_str

        public static java.math.BigInteger __bigint_set_str(java.lang.String str,
                                                    java.lang.String alpha)
        Convert a numerical value in a given alphabet to a number. An alphabet consists of single-byte symbols in which each symbol represents the numerical value associated with its index/position in the alphabet. for example, consider the alphabet: !@#$%^-*() In this alphabet ! occupies index 0 and is therefore assigned that value. @ = 1, # = 2, etc. Furthermore, the alphabet contains 10 characters, so that becomes the radix of the input. Using the alphabet above, an input of @$# translates to a value of 132 (one hundred thirty-two, decimal). If the alphabet above were instead: !@#$%^-* The radix would be 8 and an input of @$# translates to a value of 90 (ninety, decimal).
        Parameters:
        str - the numerical value to be converted
        alpha - alphabet consists of single-byte symbols
        Returns:
        the numerical value of the str pattern position found in the alphabet

      • insertChar

        public static java.lang.String insertChar(java.lang.String str,
                                          char ch,
                                          int position)
        Inserts a character at a position in a String. Convenience function returns String with inserted char at an index position.
        Parameters:
        str - the original String
        ch - the character to insert
        position - the index position where to insert the ch
        Returns:
        the new String containing the inserted ch

      • __bigint_get_str

        public static java.lang.String __bigint_get_str(java.lang.String alpha,
                                                java.math.BigInteger x)
        Gets the str pattern of the alphabet given the numeric value.
        Parameters:
        alpha - alphabet consists of single-byte symbols
        x - the numerical value of the str pattern
        Returns:
        the new String of the converted value
